<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=69,EFW="2227734",CP="MOELIS & COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=869372,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK131:[15ZCV1.15ZCV79201]FO79201A.;4',USER='JFUSS',CD='10-MAR-2016;09:28' -->
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FO79201_1_69">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227734Z10-K_HTM_BG79201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	4. BUSINESS CHANGES AND DEVELOPMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp;
	Company. The shareholders are entitled to receive a portion of the economics of the operations through their direct ownership interests in shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock of
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company. The existing owners of Group&nbsp;LP will continue to receive the majority of the economics of the operations, as noncontrolling interest holders, primarily through direct
	and indirect ownership interests in Group&nbsp;LP partnership units. As a corporation, Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company is subject to United States federal and state corporate income taxes, which results in
	a material increase in the applicable tax rates and current tax expense incurred post reorganization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Group&nbsp;LP
	has one principal class of units, Class&nbsp;A partnership units. Group&nbsp;LP issued Class&nbsp;A partnership units to Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company and to certain
	existing holders of Old Holdings units. Following the reorganization, each Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership unit (not held by Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company or its subsidiaries) is exchangeable
	into one share of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company Class&nbsp;A common stock. In addition, Group&nbsp;LP issued Class&nbsp;B partnership units to Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company. The Class&nbsp;B partnership
	units correspond with the economic rights of shares of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company Class&nbsp;B common stock. The economic rights of Class&nbsp;B common stock are based on the ratio of the
	Class&nbsp;B subscription price to the initial public offering price of shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock (.00055 to 1), and the aggregate number of shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock may be
	converted to Class&nbsp;A common stock (up to a maximum of 20,000 shares). Holders of shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock are entitled to receive dividends of the same type as any dividends
	payable on outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock at a ratio of .00055 to 1.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Group&nbsp;LP
	Class&nbsp;A partnership unitholders have no voting rights by virtue of their ownership of Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership units, except for the limited
	rights described in Group&nbsp;LP's Amended and Restated Agreement of Limited Partnership. Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company Partner Holdings&nbsp;LP holds all shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock,
	enabling it initially to exercise majority voting control over Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company. Among other items, Class&nbsp;B common stock contains a condition (the "Class&nbsp;B Condition") that calls
	for Mr.&nbsp;Moelis to maintain a defined minimum equity stake. So long as the Class&nbsp;B Condition is satisfied, each share of Class&nbsp;B common stock entitles its holder to ten votes for
	each share held of record on all matters submitted to a vote of stockholders. Shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock are generally not transferrable and, if transferred other than in the limited
	circumstances set forth in Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company's Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation, such shares shall automatically convert
	into a number of shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock, or dollar equivalent, set forth in Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company's Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation. Upon failure of the
	Class&nbsp;B Condition, each share of Class&nbsp;B common stock will have one vote for each share held. Each share of Class&nbsp;B common stock may, at the option of the holder, be converted
	into a number of shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock, or dollar set forth in Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company's Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the reorganization and IPO described above, several transactions took place which impacted the Company's consolidated and combined financial statements as of, and for
	the year ended, December&nbsp;31, 2014, which included the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A pre-offering distribution to the partners of Old Holdings of $195,017 reflected within financing activities in the consolidated and
	combined statements of cash flows and in the consolidated and combined statements of changes in equity;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>

	IPO. The proceeds received related to the issuance of Class&nbsp;A common stock in connection with the IPO is recorded net of underwriting discounts, commissions and offering expenses. Net cash
	received of $163,682 during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 is reflected within financing activities in the consolidated and combined statements of cash flows. Net proceeds recorded in the

	of December&nbsp;31, 2014;

	from the sale of Class&nbsp;A partnership units to Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company is reflected within financing activities in the consolidated and combined statements of cash flows and in the consolidated
	and combined statements of changes in equity;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The tax impact associated with the one-time cash distribution to certain partners of Old Holdings is treated as an acquisition for
	U.S. federal income tax purposes of Class&nbsp;A partnership units in Group&nbsp;LP from certain partners of Old Holdings. This transaction resulted in a deferred tax asset of which approximately
	$60,946 is attributable to exchanges by certain of the partners of Old Holdings who are party to the tax receivable agreement. Pursuant to this agreement, 85% (or $51,804) of the tax benefits
	associated with this portion of the deferred tax asset are payable to certain partners of Old Holdings over 15&nbsp;years following this transaction and is recorded as amount due pursuant to tax
	receivable agreement in the consolidated and combined statements of financial condition. The remaining tax benefit is allocable to the Company and is recorded in additional paid-in-capital.

<BR>

<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	4. BUSINESS CHANGES AND DEVELOPMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$1,240 of professional fees expense associated with the one-time non-cash acceleration of unvested equity held by
	non-employee members of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company's Global Advisory Board; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>

	$4,916 of expenses associated with the one-time non-cash acceleration of unvested equity held by employees of the
	Australian JV. Half of the expenses associated with acceleration of equity held by employees of the Australian JV is included in other expenses and the other half is included in income (loss) from
	equity method investments.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Secondary Offering
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In November 2014, the Company completed a secondary offering of 6,325,000 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock in order to facilitate
	organized liquidity and increase the public float of its Class&nbsp;A common stock. In connection with the offering, the Company issued 4,509,400 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock and used the
	proceeds to acquire the same quantity (4,509,400) of Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership units. The remaining 1,815,600 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock included in the offering were sold
	by current holders of Class&nbsp;A common stock, thus having no impact on the quantity of shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock outstanding. In addition, in connection with the Company's acquisition
	of Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership units, 4,507,453 shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock were either purchased (1,509,131 shares for $28) or converted to Class&nbsp;A common stock
	(2,998,322 shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock converted to 1,658 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock based on a conversion ratio of .00055 to 1). The Company did not retain any proceeds from the
	secondary offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Immediately
	following the secondary transactions described above;
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	19,770,893 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock were outstanding;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the Company owned 19,770,893 Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership units and its economic ownership in Group&nbsp;LP increased
	from 28% to 36%;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the noncontrolling interest holders owned 34,479,961 Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership units and their economic ownership in
	Group&nbsp;LP decreased from 72% to 64%;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Partner Holdings owned all 31,621,542 shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock, enabling it to exercise majority voting control of the
	Company. Class&nbsp;B common stock is entitled to an insignificant amount of economic participation in the Company.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	transaction is treated for U.S. federal income tax purposes as an acquisition of Class&nbsp;A partnership units in Group&nbsp;LP from certain partners of Group&nbsp;LP, which
	resulted in a deferred tax asset of which approximately $80,117 is attributable to exchanges by certain partners of Group&nbsp;LP who are party to the tax receivable agreement. Pursuant to the tax
	receivable agreement, 85% (or $68,099) of the tax benefits associated with this portion of the deferred tax asset are payable to certain partners of Group&nbsp;LP over 15&nbsp;years following this
	transaction and is recorded as amount due pursuant to tax receivable agreement in the consolidated and combined statements of financial condition. The remaining tax benefit is allocable to the Company
	and is recorded in additional paid-in-capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	5. EQUITY METHOD INVESTMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Investment in Joint Venture
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On April&nbsp;1, 2010, the Company entered into a 50-50 joint venture in Moelis Australia Holdings, investing a combination of cash
	and certain net assets of its wholly-owned subsidiary, Moelis Australia, in exchange for its interests. The remaining 50% is owned by an Australian trust established by and for the benefit of Moelis
	Australia senior executives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company made a cash contribution to Moelis Australia Holdings in the amount of $4,180. The Company treated this contribution as an
	increase in equity method investments in the consolidated and combined financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, income of $308, a loss of $2,185 and income of $3,681 was recorded on this investment, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Equity Method Investment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2014, the Company made an investment of $265 into a general partner entity which invests third-party funds and is controlled by
	a related party, Moelis Asset Management&nbsp;LP. The Company has determined that it should account for this investment as an equity method investment on its consolidated and combined financial
	statements. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, $4,168 and $0 of income was recorded on this investment, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company received cash distributions from this entity in the amounts of $4,669 and $0, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation
	and amortization expenses for fixed assets totaled $2,635, $2,226 and $2,128 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	7. FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company established a fair value hierarchy which prioritizes and ranks the level of market price observability used in measuring investments at fair value. Financial instruments
	measured and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	72
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=73,EFW="2227734",CP="MOELIS & COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=1017750,FOLIO='72',FILE='DISK131:[15ZCV1.15ZCV79201]FQ79201A.;5',USER='JFUSS',CD='10-MAR-2016;09:28' -->
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FQ79201_1_73">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227734Z10-K_HTM_BG79201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	7. FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reported
	at fair value are classified and disclosed in one of the following categories (from highest to lowest) based on inputs:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;1&#151;Quoted
	prices (unadjusted) are available in active markets for identical instruments that the Company has the ability to access as of the reporting date. The Company, to the
	extent that it holds such instruments, does not adjust the quoted price for these instruments, even in situations in which the Company holds a large position and a sale could reasonably affect the
	quoted price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;2&#151;Pricing
	inputs are observable for the instruments, either directly or indirectly, as of the reporting date, but are not the same as those used in Level&nbsp;1. Fair value
	is determined through the use of models or other valuation methodologies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;3&#151;Pricing
	inputs are unobservable for the instruments and include situations in which there is little, if any, market activity for the investments. The inputs into the
	determination of fair value require significant judgment or estimation by the Company's management.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	estimated fair values of government securities money markets and U.S. Treasury Bills as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 are based on quoted prices for recent trading activity in
	identical or similar instruments. The Company generally invests in U.S. Treasury Bills with maturities of less than twelve months. See Note&nbsp;2 for further information on the Company's fair value
	hierarchy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company received convertible notes as compensation for its services. These convertible notes do not have readily determinable market
	values and are categorized accordingly as level&nbsp;3. The fair value of the convertible notes as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, was recorded at the initial transaction price and their value was
	based upon other private-market transactions for convertible notes with identical terms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following tables summarize the levels of the fair value hierarchy into which the Company's financial assets and liabilities fall as of December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_14"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's methodology for reclassifications impacting the fair value hierarchy is that transfers in/out of the respective category are reported at fair value as of the beginning of
	the period in which the reclassification occurred. The changes to the Company's investments classified as Level&nbsp;3 are as follows for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	were no transfers between Level&nbsp;1, Level&nbsp;2 or Level&nbsp;3 during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Investment Risk Factors and Concentration of Investments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company's financial instruments are subject to the following risk factors:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Market Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Market risk represents the loss that can be caused by a change in the fair value of a financial instrument.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	74
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

	7. FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

<B>

<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Currency Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is exposed to the risk that the exchange rate of the U.S. dollar relative to other currencies may have an adverse effect on
	the reported value of the Company's non-U.S. dollar denominated or based assets and liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	*
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Primarily
	related to non-deductible equity compensation associated with the vesting of Group&nbsp;LP units.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	income taxes reflect the net effect of temporary differences between the tax basis of an asset or liability and its reported amount in the Company's consolidated and combined
	statements of financial condition. These temporary differences result in taxable or deductible amounts in future years. The significant components of deferred tax assets and liabilities included on
	the Company's consolidated and combined statements of financial condition are as follows:
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had accumulated net foreign operating loss carryforwards related to our international operations of approximately $35,846 for which we have
	recorded a deferred tax asset of $9,043. Approximately $31,195 of the operating losses (or $7,479 of the deferred tax asset) has an indefinite life and $4,650 of the operating losses (or $1,564 of the
	deferred tax asset) will expire on dates between 2019 and 2023. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company's management concluded that a valuation allowance should be established with regard to the tax
	benefits associated with foreign net operating losses, as it is more likely than not that these losses will not be fully utilized in future years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	76
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=77,EFW="2227734",CP="MOELIS & COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=713997,FOLIO='76',FILE='DISK131:[15ZCV1.15ZCV79201]FQ79201A.;5',USER='JFUSS',CD='10-MAR-2016;09:28' -->
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FQ79201_1_77">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227734Z10-K_HTM_BG79201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	8. INCOME TAXES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;U.S.
	income and foreign withholding taxes are not provided for on the undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries that are essentially permanent in nature. There were no significant
	untaxed foreign earnings at December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company is subject to taxation in certain U.S., state, local, and foreign jurisdictions. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company's tax years for 2014, 2013, and 2012 are subject
	to examination by the tax authorities. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company does not expect any material changes in its tax provision related to any outstanding current examinations.
	Developments with respect to such examinations are monitored on an ongoing basis and adjustments to tax liabilities are made as appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has no unrecognized tax benefits for the periods ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior
	to the Company's reorganization and IPO of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company, the Company had been primarily subject to the New York City unincorporated business tax ("UBT") and certain
	other foreign, state and local taxes. The Company's operations were historically comprised of entities that are organized as limited liability companies and limited partnerships. For U.S. federal
	income tax purposes, taxes related to income earned by these entities represent obligations of the individual partners and members and have historically not been reflected in the consolidated and
	combined statements of financial condition. In connection with the Company's reorganization and IPO, the Company became subject to U.S. corporate federal, state and local income tax on its allocable
	share of results of operations from Group&nbsp;LP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company recorded an increase in the net deferred tax asset of $5,368 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, which was primarily attributable to an increase in deferred
	compensation. The changes in deferred tax assets also reflects the net effect of an increase in the step-up in tax basis in Group&nbsp;LP assets resulting from the exchange of Class&nbsp;A
	partnership units in Group&nbsp;LP for Class&nbsp;A common stock coupled with the depreciation and amortization of such assets during the year. Approximately $1,975 of the deferred tax asset
	related to the step-up in tax basis is attributable to exchanges executed in 2015 by certain partners of Group&nbsp;LP who are party to the tax receivable agreement. Pursuant to this agreement, 85%
	(or $1,679) of the tax benefits associated with this deferred tax asset are payable to such exchanging partners over 15&nbsp;years following these transactions and is recorded as amount due pursuant
	to tax receivable agreement in the consolidated and combined statements of financial condition. The remaining tax benefit is allocable to the Company and is recorded in additional paid-in-capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	77
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	allocation of income (loss) to Class&nbsp;A shareholders only began following the IPO closing on April&nbsp;22, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	have not included the impact of Class&nbsp;B common stock because these shares are entitled to an insignificant amount of economic participation.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Class&nbsp;A
	partnership units may be exchanged for Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company Class&nbsp;A common stock on a one-for-one basis, subject to applicable
	lock-up, vesting and transfer restrictions. If all Class&nbsp;A partnership units were to be exchanged for Class&nbsp;A common stock, fully diluted Class&nbsp;A common stock outstanding would be
	55,481,167 and 54,250,854 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. In computing the dilutive effect, if any, that the aforementioned exchange would have on net income
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	78
</FONT>
</P>

</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227734Z10-K_HTM_BG79201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. NET INCOME (LOSS) PER SHARE ATTRIBUTABLE TO CLASS A COMMON SHAREHOLDERS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(loss)
	per share, net income (loss) available to holders of Class&nbsp;A common stock would be adjusted due to the elimination of the noncontrolling interests in consolidated entities associated
	with the Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership units (including any tax impact). For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, such exchange is not reflected in diluted net income (loss)
	per share as the assumed exchange is not dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, certain shares of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company's Class&nbsp;A common stock assumed to be issued
	pursuant to certain RSUs as calculated using the treasury stock method were antidilutive and therefore have been excluded from the calculation of diluted net income (loss) per share attributable to
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the additional weighted average amount of RSUs that would have been included in this calculation if the effect were
	dilutive would have been 1,380 and 2,315,512 units, respectively. Antidilution in the prior year is the result of the Company producing a loss for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
	Additionally, during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the additional weighted average amount of options that would have been included in this calculation if the effect were dilutive would have
	been 3,296,906. No options were excluded from this calculation for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. EQUITY-BASED COMPENSATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Partnership Units
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to the Company's restructuring and IPO, the Parent's ownership structure was comprised of common partners (principally outside
	investors) holding units and employees holding units, which collectively represented the partnership interests in the Parent and evidence of the right to receive distributions and allocations of net
	profit and losses as defined in the Parent Limited Partnership Agreement. The common partners contributed capital to the Parent and are not subject to vesting. Units granted to Managing Directors upon
	joining the Company and as part of annual incentive compensation generally vested based on service over five to eight years. Certain non-Managing Director employees were granted units as part of their
	incentive arrangements and these units generally vest based on service ratably over four years. In connection with the Company's restructuring and IPO, substantially all of the Managing Director
	partner equity subject to vesting had been accelerated. Units granted to non-Managing Director employees were not accelerated in connection with the Company's restructuring and IPO and continue to
	vest based on the original terms of the grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the reorganization and IPO, Group&nbsp;LP issued Class&nbsp;A partnership units to Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company and to certain existing holders of Old Holdings.
	Following the reorganization, a Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership unit (not held by Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company or its subsidiaries) is exchangeable into one share of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
	Class&nbsp;A common stock and represents the Company's noncontrolling interests. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, partners held 33,803,921 Group&nbsp;LP partnership units, 636,996 of which were
	unvested and will continue to vest over their service life.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	relation to the vesting of units, the Company recognized compensation expenses of $3,730, $101,895 and $48,539 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013,
	respectively. As of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	79
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=80,EFW="2227734",CP="MOELIS & COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=915047,FOLIO='79',FILE='DISK131:[15ZCV1.15ZCV79201]FS79201A.;8',USER='ABEAULI',CD='11-MAR-2016;15:41' -->
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS79201_1_80">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227734Z10-K_HTM_BG79201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. EQUITY-BASED COMPENSATION (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;31,
	2015, there was $6,067 of unrecognized compensation expense related to unvested Class&nbsp;A partnership units which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period
	of 2.2&nbsp;years, using the graded vesting method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	2014 Omnibus Incentive Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the IPO, the Company adopted the Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company 2014 Omnibus Incentive Plan (the "Plan") to provide
	additional incentives to selected officers, employees, Managing Directors, non-employee directors, independent contractors, partners, senior advisors and consultants. The Plan provides for the
	issuance of incentive stock options ("ISOs"), nonqualified stock options, stock appreciation rights ("SARs"), restricted stock, RSUs, stock bonuses, other stock-based awards and cash awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the first quarter of 2015, the Board of Directors authorized the repurchase of up to $25&nbsp;million of shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock of the Company and/or Class&nbsp;A
	partnership units of Group&nbsp;LP with no expiration date. Under this share repurchase program, shares may be repurchased from time to time in open market transactions, in privately negotiated
	transactions or otherwise. The timing and the actual number of shares repurchased will be opportunistic and measured in nature and will depend on a variety of factors, including price and market
	conditions. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, approximately $20&nbsp;million of shares remain that may yet be purchased under the program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Restricted Stock and Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the Plan and in connection with the Company's annual compensation process and ongoing hiring process, the Company has
	issued 2,906,452 RSUs in 2015 which generally vest over a service life of four to five years. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company recognized expenses of $38,295 and
	$12,742 respectively, in relation to the vesting of RSUs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table summarizes activity related to restricted stock and RSUs for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the total compensation expense related to unvested restricted stock and RSUs not yet recognized was $82,252. The Company assumes a forfeiture rate of 3%

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	November&nbsp;24, 2014 the Company paid a special dividend of $1.00 per share to common stock holders of record as of November&nbsp;10, 2014. As required under Section&nbsp;5 of
	the Company's 2014 Omnibus Incentive Plan, the Compensation Committee of the Company's Board of Directors equitably reduced the exercise price of the Company's outstanding options to purchase common
	stock by $1.00 from $25.00 per share to $24.00 per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table summarizes activity related to stock options for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company recognized expenses of $4,106 and $3,109, respectively, in relation to these stock options. As of December&nbsp;31,
	2015, the total compensation
	expense related to unvested stock options not yet recognized was $11,050. The Company assumes a forfeiture rate of 3% annually based on expected turnover and periodically reassesses this rate. This
	compensation expense is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 2.8&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)

</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	11. STOCKHOLDERS EQUITY
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	IPO and Reorganization
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In April 2014, the Company issued 15,263,653 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock as
	follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	7,699,851 shares in connection with the reorganization;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	7,475,000 shares in connection with the IPO; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	88,802 shares in connection with the settlement of appreciation rights issued in prior years.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Secondary Offering
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In November 2014, the Company completed a secondary offering of 6,325,000 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock in order to facilitate
	organized liquidity and increase the public float of its Class&nbsp;A common stock. In connection with the offering, the shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock outstanding of the Company increased by
	4,511,058 shares as a result of the Company acquiring additional Class&nbsp;A partnership units in Group&nbsp;LP. The Company did not retain any proceeds from the secondary offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 20,536,740 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock were issued and 20,273,118&nbsp;shares were outstanding. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, 19,770,893
	shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock were issued and outstanding, due primarily to the IPO and secondary offering transactions described above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Class&nbsp;B Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	IPO and Reorganization
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In conjunction with Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company's IPO of its Class&nbsp;A common stock, the Company issued 36,158,698 shares of
	Class&nbsp;B common stock. The economic rights of Class&nbsp;B common stock are based on the ratio of the Class&nbsp;B subscription price to the initial public offering price of shares of
	Class&nbsp;A common stock (.00055 to 1), and the aggregate number of shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock may be converted to Class&nbsp;A common stock (up to a maximum of 20,000 shares). Holders
	of shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock are entitled to receive dividends of the same type as any dividends payable on outstanding shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock at a ratio of .00055 to 1.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Secondary Offering
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the secondary offering in November 2014, Partner Holdings surrendered 2,998,322 shares of Class&nbsp;B common
	stock and was issued 1,658 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock at a conversion ratio of .00055 to 1. The Company also purchased 1,509,131 shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock from Partner Holdings
	for cash of $28 and subsequently cancelled those shares. The Company did not retain any proceeds from the secondary offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, 31,229,236 and 31,621,542 shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock were issued and outstanding, respectively, due primarily to the IPO and secondary
	offering transactions described above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	82
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>

	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	11. STOCKHOLDERS EQUITY (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Treasury Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company repurchased 263,622 shares pursuant to the Company's share repurchase
	program and shares repurchased from its
	employees for the purpose of settling tax liabilities incurred upon the vesting of RSUs. The result of the repurchases was an increase of $7,616 in the treasury stock balance on the Company's
	consolidated and combined statement of financial condition as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Noncontrolling Interests
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the Company's reorganization, Group&nbsp;LP issued Class&nbsp;A partnership units to Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company and
	to certain existing holders of Old Holdings. Following the reorganization, a Group&nbsp;LP Class&nbsp;A partnership unit (not held by Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company or its subsidiaries) is exchangeable
	into one share of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company Class&nbsp;A common stock and represents the Company's noncontrolling interests (non-redeemable). As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, partners held
	33,803,921 and 34,479,961 Group&nbsp;LP partnership units, respectively, representing a 63% and 64% noncontrolling interest in Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Moelis&nbsp;&amp;
	Company operates and controls all of the business and affairs of Group&nbsp;LP and its operating entity subsidiaries indirectly through its equity interest in
	Group&nbsp;GP, and thus the 20,273,118&nbsp;shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2015 represents the controlling interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. RELATED-PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Aircraft Lease
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;On April&nbsp;21, 2010, Manager acquired an aircraft with funds received solely from its managing member (Mr.&nbsp;Moelis). Manager
	was obligated to bear all depreciation and other
	costs of operating the aircraft related to uses other than for the Company's business. To the extent the Company utilized the aircraft for business; the Company was obligated to incur such expenses.
	During the period from January&nbsp;1, 2014 through the date of the IPO in April 2014, the Company recorded expense of $401 for use of the aircraft. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013,
	the Company recorded expense of $2,270 for use of the aircraft.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the restructuring and IPO, Manager could no longer operate the aircraft for use in the Company's business and as a result, the arrangement under which the plane was
	provided to the Company for its use was required to be restructured. Starting on April&nbsp;15, 2014, the aircraft was used by the Company pursuant to a ten-year dry lease with Manager, the terms of
	which were comparable to the market rates of leasing from an independent third party. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company incurred $280 in lease costs to be paid to manager,
	respectively. Consistent with such dry lease arrangement, the Company was obligated to bear all the costs of operating the aircraft. While the primary use of the aircraft was for business purposes,
	because of the benefit afforded to the Company in terms of security and productivity while traveling for personal reasons, the Company entered into a timesharing agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Moelis to
	allow him to use the aircraft for personal use. Under such timesharing agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Moelis was required to reimburse the Company for the maximum amount of reimbursement allowed by applicable
	Federal Aviation Administration rules. Such amounts are included in prepaid expenses and other assets on the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	83
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=84,EFW="2227734",CP="MOELIS & COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=514780,FOLIO='83',FILE='DISK131:[15ZCV1.15ZCV79201]FS79201A.;8',USER='ABEAULI',CD='11-MAR-2016;15:41' -->
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS79201_1_84">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227734Z10-K_HTM_BG79201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. RELATED-PARTY TRANSACTIONS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	consolidated
	and combined statements of financial condition. During the third quarter of fiscal 2014, Manager sold the aircraft and the ten-year dry lease was terminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August&nbsp;30, 2014, Manager acquired a new aircraft with funds received solely from its managing member (Mr.&nbsp;Moelis). The aircraft is used and operated by the Company
	pursuant to a dry lease with Manager which terminates on December&nbsp;31, 2019. The terms of the dry lease are comparable to the market rates of leasing from an independent third party. Pursuant to
	this dry lease arrangement, the lessee is obligated to bear its share of the costs of operating the aircraft. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company incurred $1,248 and
	$337 in aircraft lease costs to be paid to Manager, respectively. In addition, there are two other lessees of the aircraft; one of whom is Mr.&nbsp;Moelis and the other is Moelis Asset
	Management&nbsp;LP. These lessees share the lease, operating and related costs of the plane in proportion to their respective use pursuant to a cost sharing and operating agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Promissory Notes
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were $119 of unsecured promissory notes from employees held by the Company (December&nbsp;31,
	2014: $119). Any outstanding balances are reflected in other receivables on the consolidated and combined statements of financial condition. The notes held as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 bear
	a fixed interest rate of 4.00%. During the years
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company received $0, $831 and $383, respectively, of principal repayments and recognized interest income of $5 and $6, respectively, on such notes,
	which is included in other income and expenses on the consolidated and combined statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expense Allocations
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Prior to the Company's IPO in April of 2014, certain expenses have been allocated from the Parent based on the most relevant
	measure, including relative usage or proportion of the Company's headcount to that of the Parent. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, $2,316 and $9,477 of occupancy expenses have
	been allocated to the Company, respectively, based on the proportion of the Company's headcount to that of the Parent. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, $2,745 and $9,793 of
	communication, technology and information services expense have been allocated to the Company, respectively, based on a combination of relative usage and the proportion of the Company's headcount to
	that of the Parent. All other expenses were specifically identifiable to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management
	believes the assumptions and allocations underlying the consolidated and combined financial statements are reasonable and the allocated amounts are representative of the
	amounts that would have been recorded in the consolidated and combined financial statements had the Company operated independent of the Parent for the historical periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Services Agreement
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In connection with the Company's IPO, the Company entered into a services agreement with a related party, Moelis Asset
	Management&nbsp;LP, whereby the Company provides certain administrative services, technology, and office space to Moelis Asset Management&nbsp;LP for a fee. This fee totaled $1,698 for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, and $1,424 for the year-to-date post-IPO period ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The amount of the fee is based upon the estimated usage and related expense of all
	shared services between the Company and Moelis Asset Management&nbsp;LP during the relevant period, and will be assessed periodically by Management as per the terms of the agreement. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 the Company had balances due from Moelis Asset Management&nbsp;LP of $3 and $79, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	84
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227734Z10-K_HTM_BG79201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. RELATED-PARTY TRANSACTIONS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Joint Venture
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had a net balance due to the Australian JV of $167 and a net balance due from the
	Australian JV of $945, respectively, which are reflected in other receivables on the consolidated and combined statements of financial condition. These balances consist of amounts due from the
	Australian JV for advisory services performed and
	billable expenses incurred on behalf of the Company during the period, offset by expenses paid by the Company on behalf of the Australian JV. The relationship between the Company and the Australian JV
	is governed by a services agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Equity Method Investment
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In June of 2014, the Company made an investment of $265 into an entity controlled by a related party, Moelis Asset
	Management&nbsp;LP. The Company has determined that it should account for this investment as an equity method investment on the consolidated and combined financial statements. For the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, income of $4,168 and $0 was recorded on this investment, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company received cash distributions from this entity in the amounts of $4,669 and $0, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;From time to time, the Company enters into advisory transactions with Moelis Asset Management&nbsp;LP and its affiliates. The Company
	earned revenues associated with such transactions of $5,780, $5,829 and $450 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	13. REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the SEC Uniform Net Capital Rule (SEC Rule&nbsp;15c3-1) Alternative Standard under Section&nbsp;(a)(1)(ii), the minimum net capital requirement is $250. At December&nbsp;31,
	2015, Moelis U.S. had net capital of $41,373, which was $41,123 in excess of its required net capital. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, Moelis U.S. had net capital of $80,270 which was $80,020 in excess
	of its required net capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Moelis
	U.S. does not carry customer accounts and does not otherwise hold funds or securities for, or owe money or securities to, customers and accordingly is exempt under
	Section&nbsp;(k)(2)(ii) of SEC&nbsp;Rule&nbsp;15c3-3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, the aggregate regulatory net capital of Moelis UK was $17,586 which exceeded the minimum requirement by $17,531. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the aggregate
	regulatory net capital of Moelis UK was $22,980, which exceeded the minimum requirement by $22,919.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bank Line of Credit
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In May 2015 the Company renewed its unsecured revolving credit facility which increased the commitment amount and extended the
	maturity date to June&nbsp;30, 2017. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the commitment amount was $40,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Borrowings
	on the facility bear interest at the greater of a fixed rate of 3.50% per annum or at the borrower's option of (i)&nbsp;LIBOR plus 1% or (ii)&nbsp;Prime minus 1.50%. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had no borrowings under the credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company's available credit under this facility was $31,367 as a result of the issuance of an aggregate amount of $8,633 of various standby letters of
	credit, which were
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	85
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractual Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In the normal course of business, the Company enters into contracts that contain a variety of representations and warranties
	and which provide indemnification for specified losses, including certain indemnification of certain officers, directors and employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Joint Venture Put and Call Options
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In connection with the Company's Australian JV, the Company granted a put option in April 2010 enabling the key
	senior Australian executive to sell his shares held in the Australian JV back to the Company at fair value. The put option can be exercised if the key senior Australian executive ceases to be employed
	by the Australian JV (including due to death, disability or resignation but excluding termination for cause) and following such cessation of employment, the key senior Australian executive, the
	remaining Australian executives and the Company are unable to agree upon a restructuring of the Australian JV. If the put option is exercised, the Company will be required to pay 50% of the purchase
	price upon exercise and the remaining balance within 18&nbsp;months (in cash or listed stock). In addition, since April 2010, the Company has held a call option to purchase the shares from the Trust
	at fair value with payment terms equal to those called for under the put option.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Legal
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In the ordinary course of business, from time to time the Company and its affiliates are involved in judicial or regulatory proceedings,
	arbitration or mediation concerning matters arising in connection with the conduct of its businesses, including contractual and employment matters. In addition, government agencies and self-regulatory
	organizations conduct periodic examinations and initiate administrative proceedings regarding the Company's business, including, among other matters, compliance, accounting and operational matters,
	that can result in censure, fine, the issuance of cease-and-desist orders or the suspension or expulsion of a broker-dealer, investment advisor, or its directors, officers or employees. In view of the
	inherent difficulty of determining whether any loss in connection with such matters is probable and whether the amount of such loss can be reasonably estimated, particularly in cases where claimants
	seek substantial or indeterminate damages or where
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	86
</FONT>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated and Combined Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(dollars in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	investigations
	and proceedings are in the early stages, the Company cannot estimate the amount of such loss or range of loss, if any, related to such matters, how or if such matters will be resolved,
	when they will ultimately be resolved, or what the eventual settlement, fine, penalty or other relief, if any, might be. Subject to the foregoing, the Company believes, based on current knowledge and
	after consultation with counsel, that it is not currently party to any material pending proceedings, individually or in the aggregate, the resolution of which would have a material effect on the
	Company. Provisions for losses are established in accordance with ASC 450, "Contingencies" when warranted. Once established, such provisions are adjusted when there is more information available or
	when an event occurs requiring a change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company was previously named as one of several defendants in litigation arising from activities in 2011. The parties reached an agreement in principle to settle the litigation in
	March 2016, resulting in the Company incurring $2.8&nbsp;million of expense. While there is an agreement in principle to settle the litigation, the Company cannot make assurances whether the parties
	will agree on the final terms of the
	settlement or whether the Court will approve the settlement even if final terms of the settlement are reached. In such event, the ultimate resolution could result in higher costs for the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles, the Company is required to reflect the settlement expense, which is a subsequent event, in its financial statements for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 because the settlement is related to litigation that existed at the balance sheet date of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and the incurrence of the expense became
	probable and estimable prior to filing this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year end December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company covers substantially all U.S. salaried employees with a defined contribution 401(k) plan. Each salaried employee of the Company who has attained the age of 21 is eligible to
	participate in the 401(k) plan on their first day of employment. Any employer contributions to the 401(k) plan are entirely at the discretion of the Company. The Company accrued expenses relating to
	employer matching contributions to the 401(k) plan for years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, in the amounts of $1,779, $1,525 and $1,324, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	16. BUSINESS INFORMATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company's activities as an investment banking advisory firm constitute a single business segment offering clients, including corporations, governments and financial sponsors, a range
	of advisory services with expertise across all major industries in mergers and acquisitions, recapitalizations and restructurings and other corporate finance matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	do not allocate our revenue by the type of advice we provide because of the complexity of the transactions on which we may earn revenue and our comprehensive approach to client
	service. For example, a restructuring engagement may evolve to require a sale of all or a portion of the client, M&amp;A assignments can develop from relationships established on prior restructuring
	engagements and capital markets expertise can be instrumental on both M&amp;A and restructuring assignments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	87
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	17. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On February&nbsp;8, 2016, the Board of Directors of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company declared a special dividend of $0.80 per share in addition to a regular quarterly dividend of $0.30 per
	share. The $1.10 per share was paid on March&nbsp;4, 2016 to Class&nbsp;A common stockholders of record on February&nbsp;19, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2016, the Company reached an agreement in principal to settle a litigation matter. See&nbsp;Note&nbsp;14 for further information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	88
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_PART_II>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_II_2"></A>
<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_FY79201_ITEM_9__CHANGES_IN_AND_DISAGRE__ITE03576">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FY79201_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;None.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_FY79201_ITEM_9A__CONTROLS_AND_PROCEDURES">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227734Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FY79201_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;9A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and Procedures
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</U>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer,
	we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of the Company's disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the
	"Exchange Act")). Based upon this evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective as of the end of the period
	covered by this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Management's Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</U>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management assessed the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. In making this
	assessment, management used the criteria established by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission ("COSO") in Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework (2013). Based
	on this assessment, management has concluded that, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our internal control over financial reporting was effective, at a reasonable assurance level.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Because
	we are an "emerging growth company" under the Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act of 2012, this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K does not include an attestation report of our
	independent registered public accounting firm.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Changes in Internal Controls
</U>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No change in our internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) of the Exchange Act)
	occurred during the period covered by this report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

	the terms of the agreements or other documents themselves, and you should not rely on them for that purpose. In particular, any representations and warranties made by us in these agreements or other
	documents were made solely within the specific context of the relevant agreement or document and may not describe the actual state of affairs as of the date they were made or at any other time.

	them, his true and lawful attorneys-in-fact and agents, with full power to act separately and full power of substitution and resubstitution, for him and in his name, place and stead, in any and all
	capacities, to sign any and all amendments (including post-effective amendments) to this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K and all amendments thereto the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended,
	and to file the same, with all exhibits thereto, and all other documents in connection therewith, with the SEC, granting unto each said attorney-in-fact and agent full power and authority to do and
	perform each and every act in person, hereby ratifying and confirming all that said attorneys-in-fact and agents or either of them or his or their substitute or substitutes may lawfully do or cause to
	be done by virtue hereof.

<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227734ZEX-23_1_HTM_KG79201_EXHIBIT_23_1">

	Exhibit&nbsp;23.1

<EFX_EXPERTS_CONSENT>
<A NAME="FIS_EXPERTS_CONSENT"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227734ZEX-23_1_HTM_KG79201_CONSENT_OF_INDEPENDENT__KG702321">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227734ZEX-23_1_HTM_TOC_KG79201_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We consent to the incorporation by reference in Registration No.&nbsp;333-197955 and No.&nbsp;333-202355 on Form&nbsp;S-8 and
	Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-203499 on Form&nbsp;S-3 of our report dated March&nbsp;14, 2016, relating to the consolidated and combined financial statements and financial statement
	schedule of Moelis&nbsp;&amp; Company and subsidiaries (the "Company") appearing in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of the Company for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	/s/
	DELOITTE&nbsp;&amp; TOUCHE&nbsp;LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	New
	York, New York
<BR>
	March&nbsp;14, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
